result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Clerk's office was not able to mail this out to the defendant as we do not have a current mailing address. (am)

2:17 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Davonte L Montriel not in court.  Attorney Jeffery Jensen, for attorney Eryn M Menden, in court for Davonte L Montriel.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Jensen advises he has no explanation for the defendant's non-appearance.  State requests a capias be issued and bail be revoked and/or forfeited.  Court will issue capias and orders bail be forfeited.
EXT Code #2.

Hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Hearing on June 3, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:09 AM Defendant Davonte L Montriel in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Officer Barber, of the City of Delafield Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Wittchow.
Cross examination by attorney Menden.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State presents arguments and moves for bind over.
The Defense presents arguments and objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 20, 2022 at 10:15 am.
